descendants.content:
@darrenmorin @amgine just thought I'd put some context around Alberta... Since it's my home.

The UCP won 52.6% of votes in the last election; with much stronger support in rural areas. The rest of us (>44%) are along for the ride, despite efforts / votes to change things for the better.

I know people who had their car vandalized on Vancouver island because of their AB license plates, and told to go home. They didn't support our current government.

Like anywhere, there are great people too!

account.note: Dad, Skier, Photographer, Engineer.

descendants.content:

Alberta needs more capable representation in Federal Parliament, then.

descendants.content:
@mikebirdgeneau @darrenmorin

I am on VI. I have never seen that other than during the Covid lock-downs. I am very sorry for your acquaintances' experience.

I wrote the OP because I wanted to draw attention to people losing their empathy. It is understandable, given the actions of the UCP to cut their fire funding and then ask Canda to bail them out. But Canadians help Canadians; it's what we do.

Electoral reform should mean 52.6% of #ABLeg is UCP. Sadly, it has not happened.

descendants.content:
@amgine I completely understand the fading empathy watching our government act the way they do!

Whether it's cutting wildfire funding with fire risk increasing then calling upon others for help, or relaxing covid restrictions before calling in the military for extra ICU nursing support... The list goes on.

I just find that it's easy to forget that there is great diversity within each province. In the era of polarized online discourse, I like reminding myself that the world is shades of grey.

descendants.content:
@Bit_form

Nearly half of #Albertans did not vote for this government. It is no more fair to blame the citizens of #AB for their rogue govt than it is to blame you for M Bill Blair's rogue thuggery at the G20.

But the sad thing is, the current #UCP leadership are not "licking big oils toesies": they are Big Oil. Far too many of them are executives/marketing/contractors/"consultants"/lobbyists in the #FossilFuel industry.

Government by the extractors, for the extractors.
